intro: Poteranthera minor, commonly known as the narrowleaf false heath, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and woodland areas. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
